MetadataOperation.description: A required metadata operation. Can only be set to CREATE.

Version.description: The table version for the Iceberg table. Defaults to 2.

IcebergInput.description: Specifies an input structure that defines an Apache Iceberg metadata table.
Specifies an `IcebergInput` structure that defines an Apache Iceberg metadata table.

OpenTableFormatInput.description: Specifies an `OpenTableFormatInput` structure when creating an open format table.

SortOrder.description: Indicates that the column is sorted in ascending order ( `== 1` ), or in descending order ( `==0` ).

Order.description: Specifies the sort order of a sorted column.

RegistryName.description: The name of the schema registry that contains the schema.

SchemaArn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema. One of `SchemaArn` or `SchemaName` has to be
provided.

SchemaName.description: The name of the schema. One of `SchemaArn` or `SchemaName` has to be provided.

SchemaId.description:
A structure that contains schema identity fields. Either this or the `SchemaVersionId` has to be
provided.

A structure that contains schema identity fields. Either this or the `SchemaVersionId` has to be
provided.

SchemaVersionId.description: The unique ID assigned to a version of the schema. Either this or the `SchemaId` has to be provided.

SchemaVersionNumber.description: The version number of the schema.

SchemaReference.description: An object that references a schema stored in the AWS Glue Schema Registry.

Parameters.description: These key-value pairs define initialization parameters for the SerDe.

SerializationLibrary.description: Usually the class that implements the SerDe. An example is `org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.columnar.ColumnarSerDe` .

SerdeInfo.description: Information about a serialization/deserialization program (SerDe) that serves as an extractor and loader.

SkewedColumnNames.description: A list of names of columns that contain skewed values.

SkewedColumnValueLocationMaps.description: A mapping of skewed values to the columns that contain them.

SkewedColumnValues.description: A list of values that appear so frequently as to be considered skewed.

SkewedInfo.description: Specifies skewed values in a table. Skewed values are those that occur with very high frequency.

BucketColumns.description: A list of reducer grouping columns, clustering columns, and bucketing columns in the table.

Columns.description: A list of the `Columns` in the table.

Compressed.description: `True` if the data in the table is compressed, or `False` if not.

InputFormat.description: The input format: `SequenceFileInputFormat` (binary), or `TextInputFormat` , or a custom format.

Location.description: The physical location of the table. By default, this takes the form of the warehouse location, followed by the database location in the warehouse, followed by the table name.

NumberOfBuckets.description: Must be specified if the table contains any dimension columns.

OutputFormat.description: The output format: `SequenceFileOutputFormat` (binary), or `IgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat` , or a custom format.

Parameters.description: The user-supplied properties in key-value form.

SchemaReference.description: An object that references a schema stored in the AWS Glue Schema Registry.

SkewedInfo.description: The information about values that appear frequently in a column (skewed values).

SortColumns.description: A list specifying the sort order of each bucket in the table.

StoredAsSubDirectories.description: `True` if the table data is stored in subdirectories, or `False` if not.

StorageDescriptor.description: Describes the physical storage of table data.

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the table resides.

DatabaseName.description: The name of the catalog database that contains the target table.

Name.description: The name of the target table.

TableIdentifier.description: A structure that describes a target table for resource linking.

Name.description: The table name. For Hive compatibility, this is folded to lowercase when it is stored.

Owner.description: The table owner. Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of AWS Glue operations.

Parameters.description: These key-value pairs define properties associated with the table.

PartitionKeys.description:
A list of columns by which the table is partitioned. Only primitive types are supported as partition keys.

When you create a table used by Amazon Athena, and you do not specify any `partitionKeys` , you must at least set the value of `partitionKeys` to an empty list. For example:

`"PartitionKeys": []`

Retention.description: The retention time for this table.

StorageDescriptor.description: A storage descriptor containing information about the physical storage of this table.

TableType.description:
The type of this table. AWS Glue will create tables with the `EXTERNAL_TABLE` type. Other services, such as Athena, may create tables with additional table types.

AWS Glue related table types:

- **EXTERNAL_TABLE** - Hive compatible attribute - indicates a non-Hive managed table.
- **GOVERNED** - Used by AWS Lake Formation . The AWS Glue Data Catalog understands `GOVERNED` .

TargetTable.description: A `TableIdentifier` structure that describes a target table for resource linking.

ViewExpandedText.description: Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of AWS Glue operations.

ViewOriginalText.description: Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of AWS Glue operations. If the table is a `VIRTUAL_VIEW` , certain Athena configuration encoded in base64.

TableInput.description: A structure used to define a table.

description: The `AWS::Glue::Table` resource specifies tabular data in the AWS Glue data catalog. For more information, see [Defining Tables in the AWS Glue Data Catalog](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/tables-described.html) and [Table Structure](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/aws-glue-api-catalog-tables.html#aws-glue-api-catalog-tables-Table) in the *AWS Glue Developer Guide* .

CatalogId.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which to create the `Table` .

DatabaseName.description: The name of the database where the table metadata resides. For Hive compatibility, this must be all lowercase.

OpenTableFormatInput.description: Specifies an `OpenTableFormatInput` structure when creating an open format table.

TableInput.description: A structure used to define a table.
